info.name: Classroom
info.description:
This API facilitates the management of a classroom platform with two user types: **Teachers** and **Students**.

### **Features**:

- **Teacher Features**:
    
    - Create, update, and delete courses.
        
    - Manage course details.
        
- **Student Features**:
    
    - Browse all available courses.
        
    - Purchase courses and view enrolled courses.
        
- **Shared Features**:
    
    - Dashboard access with personalized data for both Teachers and Students after login.
        
    - Authentication and user management.
        

This collection includes endpoints for managing users, courses, authentication, and dashboards.

- Users (Students or Teachers) can register with valid credentials.
    
- Upon successful registration, they are redirected to the login page.

request.description:
- To Successfull Signup user will need to give correct creadintials username, email, password, Role(teacher/student) it will be small letters, and full name.
    
- Users (Students or Teachers) can register with valid credentials.
    
- Upon successful registration, they are redirected to the login page.

- To Successfull authentication user will need to give correct username and password.
    
- Authenticated users receive a **Bearer Token** and a **Refresh Token** in the response.
    
- Tokens enable secure access to protected endpoints and maintain long-term login sessions.
    
- In script tab there are written script to store tokens in environment variabls

- Authenticated users receive a **Bearer Token** and a **Refresh Token** in the response.
    
- Tokens enable secure access to protected endpoints and maintain long-term login sessions.
    
- In script tab there are written script to store tokens in environment variabls

request.description: The **Refresh Token** can be used to generate a new **Bearer Token** when the access token expires.

- The `/logout` endpoint accepts the **Bearer Token** in the header.
    
- Upon successful logout, all tokens are invalidated, ensuring the user is securely logged out.

request.description:
- The `/logout` endpoint accepts the **Bearer Token** in the header.
    
- Upon successful logout, all tokens are invalidated, ensuring the user is securely logged out.

item.description: This section contains API endpoints for user authentication in the Classroom Application.

request.description:
- In /course/create user must be logged in and also be a teacher.
    
- For executing this request you need to give accessToken authorization tab after choosing auth type bearer token.
    
- Also you will pass data (like example json) in body tab.
    
- Then hit the send button you will get success message.

- In /course/create user must be logged in and also be a teacher.
    
- For executing this request you need to give accessToken authorization tab after choosing auth type bearer token.
    
- Also you will pass data (like example json) in body tab.
    
- Then hit the send button you will get success message.

- For executing this request you need to give accessToken authorization tab after choosing auth type bearer token.
    
- Also you will pass coursID (like example json) in body tab.
    
- Then hit the send button you will get success messages.

request.description:
- In /course/enroll user must be logged in and also be a student.
    
- For executing this request you need to give accessToken authorization tab after choosing auth type bearer token.
    
- Also you will pass coursID (like example json) in body tab.
    
- Then hit the send button you will get success messages.

- To getting all courses user must be logged in .
    
- For executing this request you need to give accessToken authorization tab after choosing auth type bearer token.
    
- Then hit the send button you will get response success messages and data of all courses.

- To getting a single course user must be logged in .
    
- For executing this request you need to give accessToken authorization tab after choosing auth type bearer token.
    
- And you also give course id that you want to access
    
- Then hit the send button you will get response success messages and data of a course.

item.name: Dashboard Management

request.description:
- /course/enrolled/all-student In this endpoint you will see all the students those are enrolled in a course.
    
- To getting response user must be logged in .
    
- For executing this request you need to give accessToken authorization tab after choosing auth type bearer token.
    
- And you also give course id which course you want to see.
    
- Then hit the send button you will get response success messages and see enrolled students.

In dashboard a teacher will see all the course that he created, and see a create button to create more courses .The student will see all the courses that he enrolled, he will also see a see more button to buy more courses. They both will access the user profile in right top corner.

- To getting response user must be logged in .
    
- For executing this request you need to give accessToken authorization tab after choosing auth type bearer token.
    
- Then hit the send button you will get response success messages and see dashboard.

- in /profile/details user will see and edit their user profile.
    
- To getting response user must be logged in .
    
- For executing this request you need to give accessToken authorization tab after choosing auth type bearer token.
    
- Then hit the send button you will get response success messages and see profile details.

item.description: After successful login, users are redirected to their personalized dashboard based on their role (Student or Teacher).
